name: BruteForceAttack
description: Case template for managing brute force or password-spraying incidents.
author: Jes√∫s Angosto
summary: Investigation and mitigation of a brute force attack against exposed systems.

tasks.title: Detect brute force attempts
tasks.description: Analyze authentication logs and security alerts to identify attack patterns (volume, origin, credentials used).

tasks.title: Identify target systems
tasks.description: Locate exposed services and endpoints that are under attack.

tasks.title: Block attack sources
tasks.description: Block malicious IPs/ASNs through firewalls or perimeter security services.

tasks.title: Verify successful access
tasks.description: Review whether any attempt succeeded and assess impact.

tasks.title: Harden access policies
tasks.description: Enable MFA, limit login attempts, and strengthen password policies.

tasks.title: Maintain chain of custody
tasks.description: Preserve relevant evidence such as authentication logs, alerts, and forensic artifacts.

tasks.title: Capture lessons learned
tasks.description: Update detection and hardening processes after the post-incident review.

notes.title: Attack patterns
notes.content: Summary of detected patterns: number of attempts, schedule, originating IPs.

notes.title: Target systems
notes.content: List of services and systems targeted by the attack.

notes.title: Collected evidence
notes.content: Authentication logs, IDS/IPS alerts, and other preserved data.

notes.title: Chain of custody
notes.content: Complete log of how evidence was handled and preserved.

notes.title: Lessons learned
notes.content: Measures and recommendations to prevent future brute force attacks.
